enWisdom: This world is the abode of the wretched

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَالْوَلَهَ بِالدُّنْيَا فَإِنَّهَا تُورِثُكَ الشَّقَاءَ وَالْبَلَاءَ وَتَحْدُوكَ عَلَى بَيْعِ الْبَقَاءِ بِالْفَنَاءِ
enWisdom: Do not be infatuated with this world, for it brings you wretchedness and tribulation and impels you to sell the eternal for the transient
The gravest of errors is loving this world
The gravest of afflictions and wretchedness is [caused by] infatuation with this world
The cause of wretchedness is love of this world
This world is what the wretched desire

Wisdom: كُلَّمَا ازْدَادَ الْمَرْءُ بِالدُّنْيَا شُغُلًا وَزَادَ بِهَا وَلَهاً أَوْرَدَتْهُ الْمَسَالِكَ وَأَوْقَعَتْهُ فِي الْمَهَالِكِ
enWisdom: Whenever a person becomes more preoccupied and infatuated with this world, it makes him enter paths [of danger] and fall into places of destruction

Wisdom: مَنِ اعْتَمَدَ عَلَى الدُّنْيَا فَهُوَ الشَّقِيُّ الْمَحْرُومُ
enWisdom: One who relies on this world is indeed wretched and deprived

Wisdom: مَنْ كَانَتِ الدُّنْيَا هَمَّهُ طَالَ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ شَقَاؤُهُ وَغَمُّهُ
enWisdom: One whose concern [and effort] is for this world, his wretchedness and misery will be prolonged on the Day of Resurrection
